description.raw:
Tested using `xvfb` in ubuntu bionic. Note ogre2 needs min opengl version of 3.3\+ but the version reported when run under xvfb is 3.0 \(see [this post](https://askubuntu.com/questions/850900/why-is-my-opengl-version-stuck-at-3-0-despite-new-hardware-software) for more info\) so we need to manually override the driver version by setting `MESA_GL_VERSION_OVERRIDE=3.3`. See changes in bitbucket-pipelines on how to run the tests headless

I had to make 2 fixes:

1. ported fix from this [gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2442/check-fsaa-support-when-creating-camera/diff) so that we don’t set anti-aliasing to levels that are not supported
2. mouse picking / selection buffer - testing under xvfb helped catch a precision error in object’s rgb values. Also updated the glsl shaders to version 330
